comments.body: I didn't want to worry about cp barfing if the file already existed.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +37,41 @@
for generated_file in ${generated_files[@]}; do
  cat "${generated_file}" > "${generated_file}.original"
done

comments.body:
Sorry - I'm not sure I understand it.
Since you just generated the new file, why are you restoring the old one?

Also - if you're modifying this script, you should probably also update update-codecgen.sh

codecgen now pays attention to whether a custom encode/decode func has already been implemented for the object. update-codecgen.sh removes the generated file and regenerates it, so it is starting with a clean slate. verify-codecgen.sh generates to a new tmp file, and the existing real file was causing it to behave differently, because there were custom encode/decode funcs for the types in it. My change moves the real file to a .bak file so it doesn't affect the verify copy, then moves it back for diffing.

Sure - it seems I must have been really sleepy when writing this comment.
Yeah - what you are doing seems ok.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +105,109 @@  cat "${base_generated_file}.1tmp" >> "${base_generated_file}.tmp"
  rm "${base_generated_file}.1tmp"
  # restore the generated file
  mv "${base_generated_file}.bak" "${base_generated_file}"
  ret=0

comments.body: I don't think you need the install line - just `go get -u github.com/tools/godep` should be sufficient
also, Travis, Shippable, and Jenkins all install godep before running any checks. So this may not be strictly necessary here?

I tried without install line and it doesn't work.
Also, it seems that godep is not in PATH, so it seems not obvious to use.
So I would prefer leaving as is - we can consider unifying scripts at some point.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +52,56 @@export GOPATH="${_tmpdir}"
go get -u github.com/tools/godep 2>/dev/null
go install github.com/tools/godep 2>/dev/null
GODEP="${_tmpdir}/bin/godep"
export GOPATH=${_gopath}

comments.body: I assume all this hackery is because of Travis? Could you leave some comments explaining why this is here?
